Class GameEnvironment

  • java.lang.Object
    • GameEnvironment

  • public class GameEnvironment
extends java.lang.Object
    This is the main class of the Game that runs the game. The game is broken down in to two sections determined by progression. Setting up the game, team and heroes are linear progression while the each city would be considered circular progression. The setup GUI and the city loops are launched form this class.
    Author:
    Sachin Sakthivel and Sasiru Goonatillake Date: April 29th 2018

        This Method closes the GUI element StartUpSCREEN and launches the next GUI element, the GameSetupSCREEN.
        Parameters:

      • launchGameSetupSCREEN

        public void launchGameSetupSCREEN​()
        This method instantiate and launches the GUI element GameSetupSCREEN which lets the user create a team, specify a team size and the number of cities the user would like to explore.

      • closeSetupScreen

        public void closeSetupScreen​(GameSetupSCREEN setup)
        This method closes the GUI element GameSetupSCREEN uses the data gathered to setup the Circular progression loop. The GUI element HeroSetupSCREEN is launched after the creation of a team for the current game.
        Parameters:
        setup - The data gathered in the GUI element GameSetupSCREEN is passed on to the current method.

      • launchHeroSetupSCREEN

        public void launchHeroSetupSCREEN​()
        This method instantiate and launches the GUI element HeroSetupSCREEN which lets the user create a hero giving it a name and choosing a hero type.

      • closeHeroSetupScreen

        public void closeHeroSetupScreen​(HeroSetupSCREEN heroCreate)
        This method closes the current GUI element HeroSetupSCREEN.
        Parameters:
        heroCreate - Variable referencing the instance of the GUI element HeroSetupSCREEN currently being displayed

      • launchHomeBaseSCREEN

        public void launchHomeBaseSCREEN​(boolean isFinal)
        This method instantiate and launches the GUI element HomeBaseSCREEN which represents each city and a boolean variable to identify if the HomeBaseSCREEN being created represents the Final city of the users playthrough.
        Parameters:
        isFinal - Variable which is used to verify if the HomeBaseSCREEN being created represents the Final city of the users playthrough.

      • closeHomeBaseSCREEN

        public void closeHomeBaseSCREEN​(HomeBaseSCREEN home)
        This method closes the current GUI element HomeBaseSCREEN.
        Parameters:
        home - Variable referencing the instance of the GUI element HomeBaseSCREEN currently being displayed.

      • launchPowerUpSCREEN

        public void launchPowerUpSCREEN​(HomeBaseSCREEN homeBase)
        This method instantiate and launches the GUI element PowerUpSCEEN which enables users to upgrade skills of their heroes. The current HomeBaseSCREEN is hidden and the PowerUPSCREEN is launched. HomeBaseSCREEN is updated.
        Parameters:
        homeBase - Variable referencing the instance of the GUI element HomeBaseSCREEN currently being used.

      • closePowerUpSCREEN

        public void closePowerUpSCREEN​(HomeBaseSCREEN homeBase,
                               PowerUpSCREEN powerUp)
        This method closes the GUI element PowerUpSCREEN currently being displayed. The user's Homebase is subjected to a random event. Then the current HomeBaseSCREEN is set to visible.
        Parameters:
        homeBase - Variable referencing the instance of the GUI element HomeBaseSCREEN currently being used.
        powerUp - Variable referencing the instance of the GUI element PowerUpSCREEN that was used.

      • launchShopSCREEN

        public void launchShopSCREEN​(HomeBaseSCREEN homeBase)
        This method instantiate and launches the GUI element ShopSCREEN which enables the user to buy items for the team using their gold. The current HomeBaseSCREEN is hidden and the ShopSCREEN is launched. HomeBaseSCREEN is updated.
        Parameters:
        homeBase - Variable referencing the instance of the GUI element HomeBaseSCREEN currently being used.

      • closeShopSCREEN

        public void closeShopSCREEN​(HomeBaseSCREEN homeBase,
                            ShopSCREEN Shop)
        This method closes the GUI element ShopSCREEN currently being displayed. The user's Homebase is subjected to a random event. Then the current HomeBaseSCREEN is set to visible.
        Parameters:
        homeBase - Variable referencing the instance of the GUI element HomeBaseSCREEN currently being used.
        Shop - Variable referencing the instance of the GUI element ShopSCREEN that was used.

      • launchHospitalSCREEN

        public void launchHospitalSCREEN​(HomeBaseSCREEN homeBase)
        This method instantiate and launches the GUI element HospitalSCREEN which enables the user to heal heroes with items purchased at the shop. The current HomeBaseSCREEN is hidden and the HospitalSCREEN is launched. HomeBaseSCREEN is updated.
        Parameters:
        homeBase - Variable referencing the instance of the GUI element HomeBaseSCREEN currently being used.

      • closeHospitalSCREEN

                                hospitalSCREEN hospital)

        Parameters:

        hospital - Variable referencing the instance of the GUI element HospitalSCREEN that was used.

      • launchVillainLairSCREEN

        public void launchVillainLairSCREEN​(HomeBaseSCREEN homeBase)
        This method instantiate and launches the GUI element VillainLairSCREEN which enables the user to fight the city's villain using heroes available to them. The current HomeBaseSCREEN is hidden and the VillainLairSCREEN is launched. HomeBaseSCREEN is updated.
        Parameters:
        homeBase - Variable referencing the instance of the GUI element HomeBaseSCREEN currently being used.

      • closeVillainLairSCREEN

        public void closeVillainLairSCREEN​(HomeBaseSCREEN homeBase,
                                   VillainsLairSCREEN villainLair,
                                   boolean toHomeBase)
        This method uses the toHomeBase to determine whether the user wants to fight the villain or return to the homebase. If toHomebase is True the method closes the GUI element VillainLairSCREEN currently being displayed. The user's Homebase is subjected to a random event. Then the current HomeBaseSCREEN is set to visible. If the user decides to fight the villain then toHomebase is set to false and the method just closes the GUI element VillainLairSCREEN currently being displayed.
        Parameters:
        homeBase - Variable referencing the instance of the GUI element HomeBaseSCREEN currently being used.
        villainLair - Variable referencing the instance of the GUI element VillainLairSCREEN that was used.
        toHomeBase - Boolean value which if true indicates that user want to return to homebase, otherwise indicates the user wishes to fight the villain.

      • launchBattleSCREEN

        public void launchBattleSCREEN​()
        This method instantiate and launches the GUI element BattleSCREEN which lets the user to select a hero and battle the villain.

      • closeBattleSCREEN

        public void closeBattleSCREEN​(battleSCREEN battle)
        This method closes the current GUI element BattleSCREEN and creates a new instance of the GUI element VillainLairSCREEN.
        Parameters:
        battle - Variable referencing the instance of the GUI element BattleSCREEN currently being displayed.
